page.title: 10HELSBY MARSHES
page.content: The area referred to locally as Helsby Marshes consists of two marsh areas namely Helsby Marsh and Lordship Marsh. Before the building of the Manchester Ship canal this large area of flat land used to be flooded because it lies below seal level. The drainage ditches, which characterize the area, were dug by the German prisoners of war. Although flanked on one side by industry, nowadays the marshes provided a quiet haven for birds, wildlife and people. Bird watching groups use the marshes regularly and it is an ideal place for walkers, joggers and cyclists. Much of the land provides local farmers with grazing land for their cattle and a small amount of wheat is grown.Many people consider the area is gradually being ruined by the spread of industry but there is still much wildlife.
